title: Cheeky monkey rips off a girl's fake eyelashes as she tries to take a selfie with the primate
text:
This is the hilarious moment a monkey rips off a girl's fake eyelashes as she tries to take a selfie with the primate.

Lorena captured the footage of the Panamanian white-faced capuchin in Honduras and posted the bizarre clip to Twitter.

She shared the clip with the caption: 'So here’s a video of me trying to be all cute and sweet to this damn monkey and look what he does to me.'

Lorena captured the footage of the Panamanian white-faced capuchin in Honduras ripping off her eyelashes

The clip starts with Lorena, posing for the camera as she cradles the primate in her arms.

The monkey reaches for her eye and grabs her lashes in a tight fist.

Shocked Lorena screams 'babe' and the monkey, startled by the noise retreats onto her shoulder.

Shocked Lorena screams 'babe' and the monkey, startled by the noise retreats onto her shoulder. She then explains what happened to onlookers as the camera still rolls

Lorena then explains what happened to onlookers as the camera still rolls.

Panamanian white-faced capuchin monkeys are best known as companions to traditional organ grinders.

The species again rose to fame when one appeared in the Pirates of the Caribbean film franchise as Jack the Monkey.

As well as Honduras, they are found in Nicaragua, Costa Rica and Panama and their age can exceed 54 years.
description: Lorena filmed the Panamanian white-faced capuchin in Honduras as she held it. This species are best known as companions to traditional organ grinders
